main event: A person in Hamilton, Montana observed a large, disc-shaped object that flew across the sky and then disappeared on July 4, 1963.
interesting points: The object was brightly illuminated and changed direction several times during the 8-minute observation.
The observer had binoculars and noticed the object was smaller than a star.
The observer compared the object to ones they had seen in newspapers before.
The Air Force could not confirm the sighting and suggested it was likely caused by an Echo satellite.
The report includes tables of satellite location data for June 19, July 1, and July 8, 1963, which may be related to the sighting.
